ovdesc.p: This table allows the bank to specify to the system how its dealing room activity is organised. When applicable, dealer desks can be defined for the major currencies. The dealer desk is used as part of the key to the POSITION file. This enables the bank to view their currency position by dealer desk, if required and to book the revaluation Profit/Loss at dealer desk level.

Identifies whether the POSITION records are to be created in local currency on the value-dates for the FX transactions in cross currencies.
If this field is set to YES, then

For the FX transactions in cross currencies, the position records are generated for the transactions done by this dealer for the two cross currencies online. On the value-date these records are split and position records for buy currency against Local currency and for sell currency against Local currency are created.
If this field is set to NO or NULL then

For the FX transactions in cross currencies, the position records are generated for the transactions done by this dealer for the two currencies online. On the value-date these records are not split as above
Acceptable values are YES , NO or NULL
Default is YES
Identifies the department to which profits/losses will be allocated for this dealer desk. This field will be used during the revaluation process.
If it is desirable to keep the profitability at the dealer desk level, it is important to specify a different Profit Center code for each dealer desk.
1-4 digit numeric code. (Mandatory input) The department entered must relate to an element on the DEPT.ACCT.OFFICER table.
